definition: table/desk/classifier for tables of guests at a banquet etc
dining room for young schoolchildren unable to go home for lunch

sentences.english: Hou said he, too, felt the window panes shaking when he was at dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 侯還說當時坐在飯桌旁的他也感覺到窗戶玻璃的震動。

sentences.english: Processing In addition, soup for dinner table necessary thing.
sentences.chinese: 另外，湯爲飯桌上的必備之物。

sentences.english: Don't try to work from your coffee table or dining room table.
sentences.chinese: 千萬別在你的咖啡桌或是飯桌上工作。

sentences.english: Dr Stukeley sat at the dining-table and waited.
sentences.chinese: 斯圖克雷博士坐在飯桌邊等候。

sentences.english: Bring a few interesting stories to the table.
sentences.chinese: 準備一些有趣的故事在飯桌上講。

sentences.english: The wine was watered down before it reached the servants' table.
sentences.chinese: 酒摻了水纔拿到僕人們的飯桌上。

sentences.english: We were all laughing up our sleeves at our brother when he sat down at the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 我們在偷笑我們的兄弟，當他坐在飯桌邊時。

sentences.english: He ofter talks about his school and friends at table .
sentences.chinese: 他經常在飯桌上聊起他的學校和朋友。

sentences.english: Happiness is you family assembled at dinner .
sentences.chinese: 快樂是你得家人齊聚在飯桌旁。

sentences.english: Having stuffed himself with blackberries, Timmy could only sit staring at the dinner table.
sentences.chinese: 蒂米塞了一肚子的黑莓，在飯桌上只好乾瞪眼了。

sentences.english: Put on the table, it is a common practice in the ordinary vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 擺在飯桌上，則是家常便飯中的普通菜。

sentences.english: On the table, we have decided to work together to deal with heifengshuangsha.
sentences.chinese: 飯桌上，大家同仇敵愾決定一起對付黑風雙煞。

sentences.english: Mother was stunned for a while and put it on the kitchen table.
sentences.chinese: 母親呆呆地半晌才接過來，放在飯桌上。

sentences.english: He excused himself from the table and went up to his bedroom, but not to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 於是找個藉口離開飯桌回屋去了，但是並沒有睡覺。

sentences.english: We threaded our way through the tables.
In a fit of anger he turned the table over.
sentences.chinese: 一時氣急，他掀翻了飯桌。

definition: to pay the bill/to settle accounts/also written 結帳|结帐
to enter a door/to go in/to learn the basics of a subject/to join one's husband's household upon marriage
head of a flight of stairs
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
